data.text: MEHTSOP028 Recording outcomes with appropriate Referral to Treatment codes for discharge following an inpatient or day case admission.

table_items.text: Recording outcomes with appropriate Referral To Treatment codes for discharge following an inpatient or day case admission.
Updated RTT table with descriptions of the RTT codes
Paula Ogutu, John Cooil, Eileen Hatley, Rebecca Macklin, Dilshan Arawwawala.
Circulation list for review (Service Managers / Assistant SM / Coordinators / Ward managers):

Vanessa Evans-Green, Andrew Watson, Julia Bell, Megan Edwards, Kelly Lodge, Daniel Coleman, Karen Taberham, Paul Hawkins, Yasmin Khalil, Cheryl Snell, Janet Norton, Karen Cook, Debra Mead, Abbi Simpson, All ADOs , ADONs, Ward managers , Wendy Matthews

data.text: Purpose
The purpose of this Standard Operating Procedure (SOP) is to:
Document and standardise the process of recording outcomes with appropriate Referral To Treatment codes for discharge following an inpatient or day case admission.
Document and standardise the process for tracking and updating the patient's pathway status to ensure accurate RTT information is recorded
Provide a baseline for future process improvements
Assist in developing baseline for the development of training material
Overview
This document will outline how to choose and record the correct referral to treatment codes when a patient is been discharged from a day case or an inpatient admission.
Please refer to the Inpatient Care SOP for a detailed description of end to end inpatient processes and workflow.
The tasks listed below must be completed before the process below can be carried out:
A completed “Discharge summary” in the status of “authorised” in the patient record in Lorenzo. The discharge summary is completed by the consultant
Medications on discharge must be reviewed and requested by the nursing staff
The Plan Discharge Date (PDD ) must be updated by the nursing staff or ward clerks
Process - Record RTT codes and discharge patient in Lorenzo Role – Ward clerk / Nurse
Please complete as shown below

table_items.text: Select as appropriate from the options listed : - Patient discharged on clinical advice or with clinical consent - Patient discharged him/herself or was discharged by a relative or advocate - Patient died - Still birth (For Maternity & Neonatal wards)
Defaults to current time. please amend as appropriate if not real time

Select as appropriate from the options listed : - Treatment completed - Treatment deferred (Use only for electives when treatment did not occurred) - Left before being treated - Left refused treatment
Please see Appendix 1 for detailed screenshots
Enter all relevant discharge information i.e. details of follow up activity

data.text: End point
The patient is discharged in Lorenzo. All follow up activities / care following inpatient discharge should be booked as per the agreed protocol and process for each ward.
Appendix 1
Scenario 1 - Discharging a patient who was admitted on an emergency pathway

The New actual RTT status field will default to “98 Not applicable to RTT” as patients admitted on an emergency pathway are not RTT monitored - the user does not need to do anything - DO NOT SELECT ANY OTHER VALUE.
Once the patient has been discharged no further activity must be associated to that referral and the referral must be closed as shown below.
Discharge screen must be completed as shown below

data.url: MEHTSOP028 Recording outcomes with RTT codes for discharge 2.0.003.jpeg

data.text: Close referral screen is launched – Patients who have been admitted under the emergency referral must be discharged and referral closed at discharge.

**Please note if the patient has follow up appointments e.g. dressings/wounds in the assessment clinics discharge, a NEW referral must be added with the referral source entered as “following emergency admission”.
Lorenzo “close referral” screen

data.url: MEHTSOP028 Recording outcomes with RTT codes for discharge 2.0.004.jpeg

data.text: Click “Finish”

Scenario 2 - Discharging a patient who was admitted for an elective procedure as treatment. For example, the patient has undergone some kind of treatment procedure i.e. cataracts, hernia repair, knee replacement, hysterectomy etc.
The Nurse / ward clerk will select a Discharge method of Patient discharged on clinical advice or with clinical consent a Discharge outcome of Treatment completed.
Discharge screen must be completed as shown below

data.url: MEHTSOP028 Recording outcomes with RTT codes for discharge 2.0.005.png

data.text: Scenario 3 - Discharging a patient who was admitted for an “Elective Diagnostic” procedure. For example, the patient has undergone an investigative procedure/test/diagnostic e.g. colonoscopy, hysteroscopy etc.
Nurse/ward clerk will select a “Discharge method” of “Patient discharged on clinical advice or with clinical consent” and a “Discharge outcome” of “Treatment completed.”
Discharge screen must be completed as shown below

data.url: MEHTSOP028 Recording outcomes with RTT codes for discharge 2.0.006.jpeg

data.text: Scenario 4 – Discharging a patient that dies during admission.
Nurse/ward clerk will select a “Discharge method” of “Patient Died “and “a Discharge outcome” of Patient Died will auto default.
Discharge screen must be completed as shown below

data.url: MEHTSOP028 Recording outcomes with RTT codes for discharge 2.0.007.png

data.text: Scenario 5 - Discharging a patient that is admitted but was unable to have elective surgery / treatment for Trust or medical reason.
Nurse/ward clerk will select a “Discharge method” of “Patient discharged on clinical advice or with clinical consent” and a “Discharge outcome” of “Treatment deferred.”
The user will select a Defer reason as to why the patient was cancelled.
Discharge screen must be completed as shown below

data.url: MEHTSOP028 Recording outcomes with RTT codes for discharge 2.0.008.png

data.text: Scenario 6 - Discharging a patient where the surgery is stopped and not completed but was unable to have elective surgery / treatment for Trust or medical reason.
Nurse/ward clerk will select a “Discharge method” of “Patient discharged on clinical advice or with clinical consent” and a “Discharge outcome” of “Treatment deferred.”
The user will select a Defer reason as to why the patient was cancelled.
Discharge screen must be completed as shown below
XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX

data.text: The appropriate dropdown values which should be selected at this point are:

table_items.text: Current Actual RTT status value & description
10 – Start of 1st Activity after ref in RTT. I.e. clock start
20 – Ongoing further activity in pathway i.e. treatment not started
11 - Re-start after period of active monitoring
20– Ongoing further activity in pathway i.e. treatment not started
20 – Ongoing further activity in pathway i.e. treatment not started
20– Further activity in pathway i.e. treatment not started
30 - First definitive treatment started, this indicates clock stop

data.text: **Please note -

The access plan will return to a status of Resources identified with an offer status of deferred for such patients. When going on to manage an offer for such patients the user will need to change the search date from the date of the admission with an end search of 28 days from the patient's admission to ensure the patient is re-admitted within 28 days.

data.text: High Level flow of Inpatient Discharge Process

table_items.text: Patient is ready to be discharged
Selects patient to be discharged from the ward pegboard on Lorenzo
Launch clinical chart to review the discharge summary
Generate summary of discharge letter as clinical correspondence
User must review the discharge summary to ensure that TTOs etc have been
From the ward pegboard, select pt and click “Actual discharge”
Discharge letter distributed to the GP
Print out a copy and hand to pt.
